CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . Synthesis and Physical Properties of Polymers. The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. Proton abstraction of 4 by n-BuLi followed by the reaction with tri-butyltin chloride gave the polycondensation precursor , 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene ( 5 ). To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 째C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). Subsequent coupling with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole afforded dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole , 14-17. NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 째C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBBn |
| PC71BM |
| PffBB-14 |
| 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione |
| 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1) |
| 3-bromothiophene |
| oxalyl dichloride |
| 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (2) |
| benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2) |
| benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3) |
| 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4) |
| 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (5) |
| 3-alkylthiophene |
| tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13) |
| dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (14-17) |
| 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole |
| NBS |
| 18-21 |
| Pd(PPh3)4 |
| chlorobenzene |
| polystyrene |
| 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene |

Note: The material names are presented in the same words as in the original paragraph, and the numbers in parentheses refer to the corresponding reference numbers in the text.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . Synthesis and Physical Properties of Polymers. The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. Proton abstraction of 4 by n-BuLi followed by the reaction with tri-butyltin chloride gave the polycondensation precursor , 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene ( 5 ). To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 째C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). Subsequent coupling with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole afforded dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole , 14-17. NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 째C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Note:

* PffBBn and PC71BM are not clearly referring to property names of materials, but rather to materials themselves.
* V oc, J sc, FF, and PCE are property names of materials.
* PffBB-14 is a material name that includes a number, which could potentially be a property name, but without further context it is unclear.

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 9.93% | Maximum power conversion efficiency (PCE) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based solar cells |
| 0.92 V | Open-circuit voltage (Voc) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based solar cells |
| 16.77 mA cm^-2 | Short-circuit current density (Jsc) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based solar cells |
| 64.36% | Fill factor (FF) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based solar cells |
| 70% | Yield of 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1) in the synthesis of PffBB-n polymers |
| 85% | Yield of benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3) in the synthesis of PffBB-n polymers |
| 2-ethylhexyl bromide | Alkylating agent used in the synthesis of 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4) |
| n-BuLi | Base used in the proton abstraction of 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4) |
| tri-butyltin chloride | Reactant used in the polycondensation reaction of 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4) with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole |
| 150 째C | Temperature at which the Stille polycondensation reaction was carried out |
| 3 days | Duration of the Stille polycondensation reaction |
| dark green solid | Appearance of the resulting polymers after the Stille polycondensation reaction |
| polystyrene | Standard used for gel permeation chromatography (GPC) to determine the molecular weight of the polymers |
| 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene | Eluent used for gel permeation chromatography (GPC) to determine the molecular weight of the polymers |

Note: The values in the "Description" column are brief summaries of the corresponding property values and may not necessarily be the exact values mentioned in the text.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 9.93% | Maximum power conversion efficiency (PCE) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based solar cells |
| 0.92 V | Open-circuit voltage (Voc) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based solar cells |
| 16.77 mA cm^-2 | Short-circuit current density (Jsc) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based solar cells |
| 64.36% | Fill factor (FF) of PffBB-14:PC71BM-based solar cells |

The above table presents the material properties mentioned in the paragraph that clearly refer to the value of a material property. The other entities mentioned in the paragraph, such as the names of specific compounds, reaction conditions, and synthesis methods, do not clearly refer to the value of a material property and have been removed from the table.
